Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Flask-based web application class that handles user authentication, registration, and session management with role-based access control.

Class Description: The WebApp class encapsulates a complete Flask web application with user authentication features. It includes database integration for user management, login/logout functionality, role-based access control, and session management.

Attributes:

app: [Flask] - The main Flask application instance
db: [SQLAlchemy] - Database instance for user management
login_manager: [LoginManager] - Flask-Login manager for authentication
User: [SQLAlchemy Model] - Database model for user accounts
SettingForm: [FlaskForm] - Form for password changes
LoginForm: [FlaskForm] - Form for user login
RegistrationForm: [FlaskForm] - Form for new user registration
CaseForm: [FlaskForm] - Form for case management

Methods:

__init__: [None]() -> [None] - Initializes the Flask application, database, forms, and routes
run: [None](host='0.0.0.0', port=8080) -> [None] - Starts the Flask development server
login_required: [function](role="ANY") -> [function] - Decorator for role-based route protection
load_user: [function](user_id) -> [User] - Callback for loading users from session
unauthorized: [None]() -> [redirect] - Handler for unauthorized access attempts
login: [function]() -> [response] - Handles user login requests
signup: [function]() -> [response] - Handles new user registration
setting: [function]() -> [response] - Handles user settings changes
logout: [function]() -> [redirect] - Handles user logout
index: [function]() -> [response] - Main application route
